newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CABINET IN PRELIMINARY DEAL ON 1998 BUDGET.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CABINET IN PRELIMINARY DEAL ON 1998 BUDGET.

text.p: The Dutch cabinet reached a preliminary agreement on Saturday on the 1998 budget which will cut taxes and social security contributions by 1.5 billion guilders in a year when parliamentary elections are due.

Finance Minister Gerrit Zalm told Dutch radio the budget negotiations had been tougher than the previous ones he had negotiated because ministers were hoping to win voters' favour ahead of the elections sheduled for May of next year.
But Zalm said that after Saturday's agreement on the expenditure side of the budget he was hopeful that talks on the revenue side could be rounded off smoothly by August.

Ministers also agreed on Saturday that the 1998 budget would include an amount of 1.5 billion guilders to be placed in a fund which would help to meet the rising cost of state old-age pensions caused by the "greying" of the population.
The budget will be presented to parliament on September 16.
